description: Another trail up canyon in the Agua Caliente Tribal Preserve.This one actually follows a real creek that actually contains water much of the time, despite being in the desert. The Seven Sisters Waterfall is at the end of the trail. Due the abundant water (for a desert that is) much of the canyon has palms along the way.GPS data returns part of the way via the Coffman trail which climbs a ridge where you can get a view of the palm line canyon from above.The is an admission fee to the preserve. Gates close at 5:00PM and you have to be out by then.
directions: From Palm Springs south on Palm Canyon drive to the Tribal Preserve, where there is right turn just after you pay your admission fee.
title: Murray Canyon
